snippet: Tina Maze of Slovenia won her third straight World Cup giant slalom to extend her lead in the overall standings, and the defending champion Lindsey Vonn placed 27th after almost crashing in St. Moritz, Switzerland.
abstract: Slovenian skier Tina Maze wins her third straight World Cup giant slalom to extend her lead in the overall standings; defending champion Lindsey Vonn places 27th after almost crashing in St. Moritz, Switzerland; other winter sports news noted.
lead_paragraph: Tina Maze of Slovenia won her third straight World Cup giant slalom to extend her lead in the overall standings, and the defending champion Lindsey Vonn placed 27th after almost crashing in St. Moritz, Switzerland.

headline.main: Maze Extends Lead in Women’s Ski Competition
